byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and Benjamin Weiser contributed reporting.
byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, MICHAEL WINERIP and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

abstract: New York City correction officers' union leader Norman Seabrook is arrested on fraud charges and accused of receiving kickbacks for putting his union’s money in high-risk hedge fund; federal agents say Seabrook, who is known to have taste for luxury goods, hatched scheme following conversation with real estate developer Jona Rechnitz in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Norman Seabrook, the president of the New York City correction officers’ union, is accused of receiving kickbacks for putting his organization’s money in a high-risk hedge fund.

headline.main: Fraud Charges Against Jail Officers’ Union Chief With a Taste for Luxury
headline.print_headline: Fraud Charges  for Union Boss Liking Luxury
